Introduction

SeeYa (Korean: 씨야) was a South Korean Kpop group under MBK Entertainment (formally known as Core Contents Media). Originally made up of 3 members: Kim Yeon Ji, Lee Bo Ram and Nam Gyu Ri, they debuted on February 24, 2006 with the singles “A Women’s Scent” and “Shoes“. They disbanded on January 30, 2011. The group re-branded later as The SeeYa, with a different line-up.
